alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Camden; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic; Coastal Ocean; Cumberland; Eastern Monmouth; Gloucester; Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Salem; Southeastern Burlington; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 1:19PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Showers with strong winds will impact portions of Atlantic, Cumberland, east central Salem, Ocean, southeastern Camden, southeastern Gloucester, Cape May, Burlington and Monmouth Counties through 215 PM EST... At 118 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers with strong winds along a line extending from Brownville to Mount Holly to Bridgeton. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. This line of showers has a history of producing wind gusts up to 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Vineland, Atlantic City, Long Branch, Millville, Bridgeton, Asbury Park, Ocean City, Cape May, Sandy Hook, Cumberland, Lakewood, Middletown, Old Bridge, Jackson, Howell, Marlboro, Manalapan, Barnegat and Pleasantville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 13 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 0 and 120. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 0 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
